fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.tests_utils

Class TestScenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.tests_utils.TestScenario

  • public class TestScenario
extends java.lang.Object
    The class TestScenario implements a test scenario to be executed by simulators defined in the DEVS simulation framework NeoSim4Java.

    Description

    A test scenario describe a simulation run were some of the actions taken by simulation models are imposed by the scenario. Hence, at the heart of a test scenario, there is a sequence of test steps performed by a set of simulation models included in the simulator and identified by their URI. Each test step is defined by the class SimulationTestStep.

    The time management used in test steps and test scenarios is based on two time lines. Test steps are planned using the class Instant. A test scenario has a start instant and an end instant. The time of occurrence of a test step is an instant between the start and end instants. This time line of instants is mapped to the time line of the simulation clock represented by the class Time of NeoSim4Java. The test scenario aligns the two time lines by having as input the start instant, the end instant and the start time in simulated time. The end time in simulated time as well as the simulation duration are deduced from former input parameters and the alignment of the two time lines.

    Each test step represents an action to be taken by some simulation model as an internal transition, perhaps exporting some external events. Steps are provided by an array of SimulationTestStep that must be ordered by ascending instants of occurrence. To help constructing complex scenarios intertwining actions performed by different simulation models, the array of steps contains all of the actions in a scenario, including all simulation models the scenario will involve. However, the execution of the test scenario makes advances per simulation models.

    As a test scenario is a simulation run, some set up may be necessary, mainly to define simulation run parameters for the simulation models appearing in the simulator. TestScenario proposes two set up types of functions, among which one must be provide at creation time:

    • a function of two parameters taking as arguments the reference to the simulator and the test scenario about to be executed, and
    • a function of three parameters taking the same two arguments plus a map of run parameters already created and that must be initialised on the simulator models.

    Optional beginning and ending messages can also be provided. To execute a test scenario, the standard DEVS protocol methods in models having steps to performed call this class methods. First, in the class implementing the simulation run, the simulator must be constructed as usual and then the set up function provided by the test scenario must be called. Then, models that do not perform steps defined in the scenario executes as usual. Models that must perform steps defined in the scenario uses the following methods of this class:

    • The methods setUpSimulator are called to set up the simulation run parameters and other configuration options.
    • The methods getStartTime(), to retrieve the simulated start time, and getEndTime(), to retrieve the simulated end time, to start the simulation by calling the chosen start method of NeoSim4Java.
    • Models having to perform test steps can retrieve the time of their next step by calling the methods simulatedTimeOfNextStep or simulatedDelayToNextStep, typically in their method timeAdvance to know whether their next internal transition in their next test step or another internal transition.
    • When a model must execute a test step, the method generateOutput is called in their output method to generate and export the external events of the test step.
    • Next, the method performInternalTransition is called by their method userDefinedInternalTransition to perform the internal transition of the test step.
    • Finally, the method advanceToNextStep is called to advance the test scenario for that model to its next test step. The method scenarioTerminated allows to check if the scenario is terminated for the model.

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       !(setUp2 != null && setUp3 != null) && !(setUp2 == null && setUp3 == null)
 invariant       simulationTestSteps != null && simulationTestSteps.length > 0
 invariant       performingAtomicModelsURIs != null && performingAtomicModelsURIs.size() > 0
 invariant       nextSteps != null
 invariant       nextSteps.keySet().stream().allMatch(uri -> performingAtomicModelsURIs.contains(uri))
 invariant       nextSteps.values().stream().allMatch(index -> index >= 0 && index <= instance.simulationTestSteps.length)
 invariant       startInstant != null
 invariant       endInstant != null
 invariant       startInstant.isBefore(endInstant)
 invariant       startTime

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

      • findNextStepIndex

        protected int findNextStepIndex(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel m)
        return the index of the next step in the scenario that the model m must perform or an index out of the range of the simulated steps in this tests scenario.

        Contract

         pre     m != null && atomicModelAppearsIn(m.getURI())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        m - an atomic model that must perform an internal transition in this scenario.
        Returns:
        the index of the next step in the scenario that the model m must perform.

      • scenarioTerminated

         pre     m != null && atomicModelAppearsIn(m.getURI())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
